sentence.Network_en: His lyrics are highly literate. He even quotes Voltaire.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的歌词体现了高度的文化修养。他甚至还引用了伏尔泰。

sentence.Network_en: We look for applicants who are numerate, computer-literate and energetic self-starters.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们对求职者的要求是具备运算能力，熟练使用电脑，精力充沛而且工作积极主动。

sentence.Network_en: We want to have more scientifically literate people running our television stations.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们想增加一些通晓科学的人手来运作电视台。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin litteratus, from littera (see letter)

entry.def: Someone who is literate is able to read and write.

example.ex: Over one-quarter of the adult population are not fully literate.
example.tran: 四分之一以上的成年人不具备完全的读写能力。

entry.tran: 受过良好教育的；（尤指）有文化修养的
entry.def: If you describe someone as literate, you mean that they are intelligent and well-educated, especially about literature and the arts.

example.ex: Scientists should be literate and articulate as well as able to handle figures...
example.tran: 科学家除了要能处理数字，还应该具有文学素养和善于表达。

example.ex: His lyrics are highly literate. He even quotes Voltaire.
example.tran: 他的歌词体现了高度的文化修养。他甚至还引用了伏尔泰。

entry.def: If you describe someone as literate in a particular subject, especially one that many people do not know anything about, you mean that they have a good knowledge and understanding of that subject.

example.ex: Head teachers need to be financially literate...
We want to have more scientifically literate people running our television stations.
example.tran: 我们想增加一些通晓科学的人手来运作电视台。

means.word_mean: 1. a person who can read and write

auth_sentence.content: He became the nerdish anti-hero of literate post-punk boys.

auth_sentence.content: No scientifically literate skeptic ever makes such a claim.

stems_affixes.word_buile: liter文字,字母+al……的→adj.文字[上]的;字面的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 文学上的,文学的;精通文学的,从事写作的
stems_affixes.word_buile: liter文字,字母+ary……的→adj.文学上的,文学的;精通文学的,从事写作的
il不+literacy[n.有文化,有教养,有读写能力]→没有文化→文盲

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有文化,有教养,有读写能力
stems_affixes.word_buile: liter文字,字母+acy性质,状态→n.有文化,有教养,有读写能力
liter文字,字母+ati表复数→文字人→文人学者
obliterate[v.涂掉,擦掉]+ion表名词→n.涂去, 删除
ob倒,去掉+liter文字,字母+ate表动词→去掉文字→擦掉

sentences.en: Only a few of the nation's peasants are literate.
sentences.cn: 这个国家的农民中只有少数人能识字。

sentences.en: He is the most literate of the whole family.
sentences.cn: 他是全家最有文化的一个。

jushi.english: Every literate person should read this book.
jushi.chinese: 凡是有文化的人都该读一读此书。

jushi.english: Only a few of the nation's peasants are literate.
jushi.chinese: 这个国家的农民中只有少数人识字。
